title.native: 黒執事 寄宿学校編

description:
Continuation of the Kuroshitsuji anime adaptation.

At the request of Queen Victoria, Earl Ciel Phantomhive goes to Weston College—a prestigious public academy for boys, known for its traditions and outstanding curriculum—to search for a relative of hers who has not returned home in months. Thanks to his noble status, the 13-year-old Ciel is swiftly able to enroll as a student, while his devilish butler Sebastian Michaelis assumes a teaching position at the school.

Ciel does not anticipate being unable to locate the Queen's relative on campus. To make matters worse, he cannot request a meeting with the headmaster of the college, who may be the only person that knows anything pertaining to the disappearance. The only ones in frequent contact with the headmaster are the heads of the college dormitories, known as the Prefect 4 (P4): Edgar Redmond, Lawrence Bluewer, Herman Greenhill, and Gregory Violet.

Ciel must concoct a plan to get in the P4's good graces if he wants to use their connections to succeed in his mission. But the distinguished college and its students hide much that is unseen, making this task more improbable than he could imagine.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: คนลึกไขปริศนาลับ ภาคที่ 4
พ่อบ้านปีศาจ ซีซั่น 4

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

SID (シド, Shido) is a Japanese visual kei rock band, formed in 2003 and signed to Ki/oon Records. Formed by Mao, Shinji, Aki and Yūya, they are known for producing anime songs, such as for Fullmetal Alchemist, Bleach, Black Butler or Magi.

__Members:__
- Vocals: Mao (マオ) 
- Guitar: Shinji 
- Bass: Aki (明希) 
- Drums: Yuuya (ゆうや)
_Note: Not to be confused with [清水雄介](https://anilist.co/staff/239774)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

Animator turned director.
